message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with video captioning, which is a task related to visual understanding. It also involves the use of motion and content features of videos, which are visual features. 

The paper also involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, such as Part-of-Speech (POS) tagging and sentence generation, which suggests that it could also belong to the Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) sub-category. 

The use of a gated fusion network and a gating strategy to incorporate global syntactic POS information into the decoder suggests that the paper could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. 

The paper involves the use of a novel model architecture and experimental results on benchmark datasets, which suggests that it could also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. 

Finally, the paper deals with video captioning, which is a task related to multimedia analysis, suggesting that it could also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
